title: CSS/XHTML Validity
body: <p>This blog isn't 100% <del>CSS or</del> XHTML compliant.  <del>The CSS is probably easily fixable, the following CSS is what's invalid:</del></p><code><del>form[id=Form2] input<br/>{<br/>	-moz-opacity: 0.50;<br/>	background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 127);<br/>}<br/><br/>form[id=Form2] input:HOVER, form[id=Form2] input:FOCUS, form[id=Form2] input:ACTIVE<br/>{<br/>	-moz-opacity: 0.90;<br/>	background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 229);<br/>}<br/></del></code><p><del>I'm sure there's an alternative to <strong>-moz-opacity</strong> that's CSS compliant, but I haven't found it yet.  I thought that the <strong>rgba</strong>(n,n,n,n) syntax was at least valid CSS3, but that didn't seem to validate either.</del>  <ins>I just switched to <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#transparency">opacity</a> and it validates and works fine in FF, yay!</ins></p><p>The XHTML isn't as easily fixable.  I'm pretty sure that this is about as valid as it gets without re-compiling the .Text source. </p><ul><li>None of the pages with forms validate due to the way .Net renders out the &lt;script&gt; tags.</li><li>The main page doesn't validate due to an asp:literal in the Day control that spits out: <em>Title&nbsp;=&nbsp;"x"</em>. (note the spacing and capitalization)</li><li>The Post pages have asp:literals that have &lt;link&gt; tags used for pingbacks in bad spots and they have end tags either.</li><li>The comments people post are converted to HTML instead of XHTML</li><li>The posts I make aren't always perfect either (damn those &amp; in urls)</li></ul><p>The last one is pretty much the only one I can control at this point.  I could probably even eliminate the last two by hacking a few SPs.  If anyone knows a solution for the others without recompiling, please let me know.  I have to say that even though .Text wasn't XHTML compliant out-of-the-box, it really has a great architecture and it has been fairly easy to upgrade to XHTML compliancy.</p>

2004-08-23

CSS/XHTML Validity

This blog isn't 100% CSS or XHTML compliant. The CSS is probably easily fixable, the following CSS is what's invalid:

form[id=Form2] input
{
-moz-opacity: 0.50;
background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 127);
}

form[id=Form2] input:HOVER, form[id=Form2] input:FOCUS, form[id=Form2] input:ACTIVE
{
-moz-opacity: 0.90;
background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 229);
}
